trans-unit.source: Learn how to attach a data disk to an Azure virtual machine and initialize it so it's ready for use.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to attach a data disk to an Azure virtual machine and initialize it so it's ready for use.

trans-unit.source: How to Attach a Data Disk to a Linux Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: How to Attach a Data Disk to a Linux Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: You can attach both empty disks and disks that contain data.
trans-unit.target: You can attach both empty disks and disks that contain data.

trans-unit.source: In both cases, the disks are actually .vhd files that reside in an Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: In both cases, the disks are actually .vhd files that reside in an Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Also in both cases, after you attach the disk, you'll need to initialize it so it's ready for use.
trans-unit.target: Also in both cases, after you attach the disk, you'll need to initialize it so it's ready for use.

trans-unit.source: This article refers to virtual machines created using the classic deployment model.
trans-unit.target: This article refers to virtual machines created using the classic deployment model.

trans-unit.source: It's a best practice to use one or more separate disks to store a virtual machine's data.
trans-unit.target: It's a best practice to use one or more separate disks to store a virtual machine's data.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has an operating system disk and a temporary disk.
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has an operating system disk and a temporary disk.

trans-unit.source: Do not use the temporary disk to store data. As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.
trans-unit.target: Do not use the temporary disk to store data. As the name implies, it provides temporary storage only.

trans-unit.source: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: The temporary disk is typically managed by the Azure Linux Agent and automatically mounted to /mnt/resource (or /mnt on Ubuntu images).
trans-unit.target: The temporary disk is typically managed by the Azure Linux Agent and automatically mounted to /mnt/resource (or /mnt on Ubuntu images).

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, a data disk might be named by the Linux kernel something like /dev/sdc, and you'll need to partition, format, and mount this resource.
trans-unit.target: On the other hand, a data disk might be named by the Linux kernel something like /dev/sdc, and you'll need to partition, format, and mount this resource.
